Education
I completed my schooling in Jawahar Navodaya Vidyalaya, Nagpur. And then joined Central University of Karnataka for BSc Psychology.

title: How to make Tables in R using kableExtra package
text:
kableExtra is the package in R and helps us to build common complex tables and also manipulate table styles. Today we are going to learn the use of {kableExtra} to make tables. And we are using penguins from {palmerpenguins}dataset for that.
To use the package we have to call it. Here we called {kableExtra} and {palmerpenguins} packages. These are the top six rows of the penguins data set.
#|label: head of penguin data 
library(kableExtra)
library(palmerpenguins)
peng <- head(penguins)
peng

# A tibble: 6 √ó 8
  species island    bill_length_mm bill_depth_mm flipper_length_mm body_mass_g
  <fct>   <fct>              <dbl>         <dbl>             <int>       <int>
1 Adelie  Torgersen           39.1          18.7               181        3750
2 Adelie  Torgersen           39.5          17.4               186        3800
3 Adelie  Torgersen           40.3          18                 195        3250
4 Adelie  Torgersen           NA            NA                  NA          NA
5 Adelie  Torgersen           36.7          19.3               193        3450
6 Adelie  Torgersen           39.3          20.6               190        3650
# ‚Ñπ 2 more variables: sex <fct>, year <int>

title: How to make Tables in R using kableextra package
text:
Table Styles
This is classic_2 theme

kbl(peng) |>
  kable_classic_2()

flipper_length_mm

title: How to make Tables in R using kableExtra package
text:
Text hovering
This package also give us a option to hover. And we can set it width by giving it a of True/False

kbl(peng) |>
  kable_classic_2("hover", full_width = F)

title: How to make Tables in R using kableExtra package
text:
Table Themes
There are many themes present in package and we can use them according to our need. For more themes you can visit to https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/kableExtra/vignettes/awesome_table_in_html.html
Here we use {kable_classic_2}

kbl(peng) |>
  kable_classic_2()

title: How to make Tables in R using kableExtra package
text:
Table Heading
Whenever we make a table then it is good practice to give heading to the table. For heading, we can use caption argument in {kbl} and give it some values which we be your heading.

kbl(peng, caption = "Recreating booktabs style table") |>
  kable_classic_2() 


Recreating booktabs style table

title: How to make Tables in R using kableExtra package
text:
Highlighting the column
In some case we want to highlight columns, then, column_spec() function we can use.

kbl(peng) |>
  kable_classic_2() |> 
  column_spec(2, color = "red")

title: How to make Tables in R using kableExtra package
text:
Font styles
We all know there are various types of font available on internet and we can use that in our tables. We have to give an argument html_font and give the name of font as a value in html_font.

kbl(peng) |>
  kable_classic_2("hover", html_font = "Cambria")
